Looking down at your notes, you begin forming a question in your head to ask Elika.

You decide to help Elika by throwing her an easier question.

"What can we do to slow down the extinction of all the different species of animals?"

Elika paused for a moment before responding with a well thought out answer. She suggested a simple solution which consisted of limiting gas emissions and lowering the greenhouse gases in our atmosphere. After that is regulated, nature will take care of the rest and the wildlife population will start to grow again.

You decide to go with a more general question.

"So what exactly is this great 'extinction' and how long until it happens?"

Elika looks around the ceiling while trying to gather her thoughts. She responds with, "well, the 6th great extinction, also known as the holocene extinction, is actually already here. It has been happening for decades now due to human activity and influence on the climate. It predicts that one half of Earth's higher life forms by the year 2100."

You decide to challenge Elika a little bit.

"I agree that overfishing and overhunting are huge problems, but fishing and hunting are also necessary to provide humanity with the resources we need to survive. My question is: How do we decide how much fishing or hunting we can do before it is too much?"

With a smile on her face and no hesitation at all, Elika responds with, "well obviously, it is different for each different species, but we can record the growth and decline of the population. So we can keep hunting and fishing a certain species, as long as the population of that species grows just as fast as it declines."

Before leaving, you pull {ifStateCondition|skepticalStudent eq true|Franklin|}{ifStateCondition|enthusiasticStudent eq true|Elika|}{ifStateCondition|shyStudent eq true|Aiden|} aside.

"Overall, I am extremely proud to see how far you have come. I remember many years ago when you were the {ifStateCondition|skepticalStudent eq true|skeptical|}{ifStateCondition|enthusiasticStudent eq true|enthusiastic|}{ifStateCondition|shyStudent eq true|shy|} student in my class, and now, you have obtained your PhD. Keep working hard and continue making me proud."
